title: Where U.S. Workers Are Quitting Jobs at Record Rates
sub_head: In September, 4.4 million workers in the U.S. resigned; here are the states and sectors that led the wave
body:
Workers in the U.S. resigned from a record 4.4 million jobs in September. Many Americans are leaving roles for better working conditions and pay amid a historically fast economic recovery.
The wave of resignations hasnâ€™t been uniform across the country, though. States in the West, including Hawaii, Montana, Utah and Oregon, saw the largest growth in quits in September, according to the Labor Department. Eighteen states broke or tied their records for quits levels in September.
